questions.question: What is the area of this composite shape?
questions.svg: <svg width="220" height="160" viewBox="0 0 220 160"><path d="M 20 140 L 20 60 L 80 60 L 80 20 L 200 20 L 200 140 Z" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="10" y="105" font-size="12" fill="#374151">4</text><text x="45" y="55" font-size="12" fill="#374151">3</text><text x="85" y="45" font-size="12" fill="#374151">2</text><text x="135" y="15" font-size="12" fill="#374151">6</text><text x="205" y="85" font-size="12" fill="#374151">6</text><text x="110" y="155" font-size="12" fill="#374151">9</text></svg>
questions.hint: Split into rectangles: big rectangle minus the cut-out corner.

questions.question: What is the circumference of this circle? (Use $\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><circle cx="90" cy="90" r="70" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="90" y1="90" x2="160" y2="90" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="120" y="85" font-size="14" fill="#374151">7 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Circumference $= 2 \times \pi \times r = 2 \times 3.14 \times 7$

questions.question: Find angle $x$.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="160" viewBox="0 0 200 160"><line x1="20" y1="80" x2="180" y2="80" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="100" y1="80" x2="40" y2="20" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="100" y1="80" x2="160" y2="20" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 80 80 A 20 20 0 0 0 88 63" fill="none" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 112 63 A 20 20 0 0 0 120 80" fill="none" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="70" y="60" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">65°</text><text x="125" y="60" font-size="14" fill="#16A34A">x</text></svg>
questions.hint: Vertically opposite angles are equal.

questions.question: What is the area of this parallelogram?
questions.svg: <svg width="220" height="140" viewBox="0 0 220 140"><polygon points="50,110 90,30 200,30 160,110" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="90" y1="30" x2="90" y2="110" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><text x="125" y="25" font-size="14" fill="#374151">10 cm</text><text x="95" y="75" font-size="14" fill="#374151">6 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Area of parallelogram $= \text{base} \times \text{height}$

questions.question: What is the area of this circle? (Use $\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><circle cx="90" cy="90" r="60" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="90" y1="90" x2="150" y2="90" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><text x="115" y="85" font-size="14" fill="#374151">5 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Area $= \pi \times r^2 = 3.14 \times 5 \times 5$

questions.question: What 3D shape does this net fold into?
questions.svg: <svg width="240" height="180" viewBox="0 0 240 180"><rect x="70" y="10" width="50" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="60" width="50" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="110" width="50" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="10" y="60" width="60" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="120" y="60" width="60" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="180" y="60" width="50" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/></svg>
questions.hint: Count the faces - this is a complete cube net with 6 squares.

questions.question: Find the missing angle in this quadrilateral.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><polygon points="40,150 20,60 120,20 180,100" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="30" y="145" font-size="12" fill="#374151">85°</text><text x="25" y="70" font-size="12" fill="#374151">110°</text><text x="115" y="35" font-size="12" fill="#374151">95°</text><text x="160" y="100" font-size="12" fill="#EF4444">?</text></svg>
questions.hint: Angles in a quadrilateral add up to $360°$.

questions.question: What is the area of this trapezoid?
questions.svg: <svg width="220" height="140" viewBox="0 0 220 140"><polygon points="50,110 30,30 170,30 190,110" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="50" y1="30" x2="50" y2="110" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><text x="90" y="25" font-size="12" fill="#374151">7 cm</text><text x="100" y="125" font-size="12" fill="#374151">11 cm</text><text x="55" y="75" font-size="12" fill="#374151">5 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Area $= \frac{1}{2} \times (\text{top} + \text{bottom}) \times \text{height}$

questions.question: Find angle $x$. Lines are parallel.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><line x1="20" y1="50" x2="180" y2="50" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="20" y1="130" x2="180" y2="130" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="60" y1="20" x2="140" y2="160" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 85 50 A 15 15 0 0 1 75 65" fill="none" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 115 130 A 15 15 0 0 1 125 115" fill="none" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="90" y="70" font-size="12" fill="#EF4444">55°</text><text x="120" y="110" font-size="12" fill="#16A34A">x</text></svg>
questions.hint: Alternate angles are equal when lines are parallel.

questions.question: What is the volume of this rectangular prism?
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><polygon points="30,100 30,40 100,40 100,100" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="100,40 150,20 150,80 100,100" fill="#C7D2FE" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="30,40 80,20 150,20 100,40" fill="#A5B4FC" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="55" y="130" font-size="12" fill="#374151">4 cm</text><text x="160" y="55" font-size="12" fill="#374151">3 cm</text><text x="55" y="15" font-size="12" fill="#374151">5 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Volume $= \text{length} \times \text{width} \times \text{height}$

questions.question: What is the area of the shaded region?
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><rect x="20" y="20" width="140" height="140" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="50" y="50" width="80" height="80" fill="white" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="90" y="175" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#374151">14 cm</text><text x="90" y="95" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#374151">8 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Big square area minus small square area.

questions.question: Find angle $x$.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><polygon points="100,20 30,150 170,150" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><text x="95" y="50" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">x</text><text x="50" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#374151">40°</text><text x="135" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#374151">40°</text></svg>
questions.hint: Triangle angles sum to $180°$. If two angles are $40°$ each...

questions.question: What is the surface area of this cube?
questions.svg: <svg width="150" height="150" viewBox="0 0 150 150"><polygon points="30,50 75,30 120,50 120,100 75,120 30,100" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="50" x2="75" y2="70" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="75" y1="70" x2="120" y2="50" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="75" y1="70" x2="75" y2="120" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="75" y="145" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#374151">5 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: A cube has 6 faces, each with area $= \text{side}^2$.

questions.question: What is the area of this rhombus?
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><polygon points="90,20 160,90 90,160 20,90" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="90" y1="20" x2="90" y2="160" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><line x1="20" y1="90" x2="160" y2="90" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><text x="95" y="95" font-size="12" fill="#374151">8 cm</text><text x="55" y="85" font-size="12" fill="#374151">12 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Area of rhombus $= \frac{d_1 \times d_2}{2}$, where $d$ is diagonal.

questions.question: What 3D shape does this net fold into?
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="200" viewBox="0 0 200 200"><polygon points="100,10 70,60 130,60" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="70,60 40,110 100,110" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="130,60 100,110 160,110" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="40" y="110" width="120" height="60" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/></svg>
questions.hint: This net has 2 triangular faces and 3 rectangular faces.

questions.question: Find the exterior angle $x$.
questions.svg: <svg width="220" height="180" viewBox="0 0 220 180"><polygon points="60,150 60,50 160,150" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="160" y1="150" x2="200" y2="150" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 60 70 L 75 70 L 75 50" fill="none" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="1"/><text x="40" y="55" font-size="12" fill="#374151">50°</text><text x="175" y="145" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">x</text></svg>
questions.hint: Exterior angle = sum of opposite interior angles.

questions.question: What is the diameter of a circle with circumference $31.4$ cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><circle cx="90" cy="90" r="65" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="90" y="95" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" fill="#374151">C = 31.4 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Circumference $= \pi \times d$, so $d = C \div \pi$

questions.question: What is the area of this composite shape?
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><rect x="30" y="60" width="140" height="80" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="100,60 30,60 100,10" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="100,60 170,60 100,10" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="100" y="165" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#374151">14 cm</text><text x="180" y="105" font-size="12" fill="#374151">8 cm</text><text x="110" y="40" font-size="12" fill="#374151">5 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Rectangle + triangle $= (14 \times 8) + (\frac{1}{2} \times 14 \times 5)$

questions.question: Angles $x$ and $y$ are complementary. If $x = 35°$, what is $y$?
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="150" viewBox="0 0 200 150"><line x1="20" y1="120" x2="180" y2="120" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="20" y1="120" x2="20" y2="20" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="20" y1="120" x2="120" y2="50" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 20 100 A 20 20 0 0 1 40 120" fill="none" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 40 120 A 25 25 0 0 1 45 95" fill="none" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="45" y="110" font-size="12" fill="#EF4444">35°</text><text x="55" y="95" font-size="12" fill="#16A34A">y</text></svg>
questions.hint: Complementary angles add up to $90°$.

questions.question: What is the volume of this cylinder? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="150" height="180" viewBox="0 0 150 180"><ellipse cx="75" cy="30" rx="45" ry="15" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><ellipse cx="75" cy="150" rx="45" ry="15" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="30" x2="30" y2="150" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="120" y1="30" x2="120" y2="150" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="75" y1="30" x2="120" y2="30" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="3,3"/><text x="95" y="25" font-size="10" fill="#374151">3 cm</text><text x="125" y="95" font-size="10" fill="#374151">10 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Volume $= \pi \times r^2 \times h$

questions.question: Find angle $x$. Lines AB and CD are parallel.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="160" viewBox="0 0 200 160"><line x1="20" y1="40" x2="180" y2="40" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="20" y1="120" x2="180" y2="120" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="40" y1="10" x2="160" y2="150" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="10" y="35" font-size="12" fill="#4F46E5">A</text><text x="185" y="35" font-size="12" fill="#4F46E5">B</text><text x="10" y="125" font-size="12" fill="#4F46E5">C</text><text x="185" y="125" font-size="12" fill="#4F46E5">D</text><path d="M 70 40 A 15 15 0 0 0 55 55" fill="none" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 145 120 A 15 15 0 0 0 130 105" fill="none" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="55" y="60" font-size="12" fill="#EF4444">70°</text><text x="120" y="105" font-size="12" fill="#16A34A">x</text></svg>
questions.hint: Co-interior angles (same side) add up to $180°$.

questions.question: What is the area of this semicircle? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="120" viewBox="0 0 200 120"><path d="M 20 100 A 80 80 0 0 1 180 100 L 20 100" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="20" y1="100" x2="180" y2="100" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="100" y="115" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#374151">16 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Semicircle area $= \frac{\pi \times r^2}{2}$. Radius $= \frac{\text{diameter}}{2}$

questions.question: What is the perimeter of this shape?
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="160" viewBox="0 0 200 160"><path d="M 30 130 L 30 50 L 100 50 L 100 30 L 170 30 L 170 130 Z" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><text x="15" y="95" font-size="11" fill="#374151">8</text><text x="60" y="45" font-size="11" fill="#374151">7</text><text x="85" y="45" font-size="11" fill="#374151">2</text><text x="130" y="25" font-size="11" fill="#374151">7</text><text x="175" y="85" font-size="11" fill="#374151">10</text><text x="100" y="145" font-size="11" fill="#374151">14</text></svg>
questions.hint: Add all outer edges carefully.

questions.question: What is the area of this kite?
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="200" viewBox="0 0 180 200"><polygon points="90,10 150,80 90,190 30,80" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="90" y1="10" x2="90" y2="190" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><line x1="30" y1="80" x2="150" y2="80" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><text x="55" y="75" font-size="12" fill="#374151">12</text><text x="95" y="100" font-size="12" fill="#374151">18</text></svg>
questions.hint: Area of kite $= \frac{d_1 \times d_2}{2}$

questions.question: A regular hexagon has interior angles of:
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><polygon points="90,20 150,50 150,120 90,150 30,120 30,50" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 90 40 A 20 20 0 0 1 130 50" fill="none" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2"/><text x="105" y="55" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">?</text></svg>
questions.hint: Interior angle of regular polygon $= \frac{(n-2) \times 180°}{n}$

questions.question: What is the volume of this triangular prism?
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><polygon points="30,140 90,60 90,140" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="90,60 150,40 150,120 90,140" fill="#A7F3D0" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="30,140 90,120 150,120 90,140" fill="#6EE7B7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="90" y1="60" x2="90" y2="120" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="3,3"/><text x="50" y="155" font-size="10" fill="#374151">6 cm</text><text x="70" y="95" font-size="10" fill="#374151">4 cm</text><text x="115" y="75" font-size="10" fill="#374151">10 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Volume $= (\frac{1}{2} \times \text{base} \times \text{height of triangle}) \times \text{length}$

questions.question: Angles $x$ and $y$ are supplementary. If $x = 115°$, what is $y$?
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="100" viewBox="0 0 200 100"><line x1="20" y1="50" x2="180" y2="50" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="100" y1="50" x2="50" y2="10" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 80 50 A 20 20 0 0 0 90 32" fill="none" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 110 68 A 20 20 0 0 0 120 50" fill="none" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="70" y="35" font-size="12" fill="#EF4444">115°</text><text x="125" y="65" font-size="12" fill="#16A34A">y</text></svg>
questions.hint: Supplementary angles add up to $180°$.

questions.question: What is the area of the shaded region? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><rect x="20" y="20" width="140" height="140" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="90" cy="90" r="50" fill="white" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="90" y="175" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#374151">14 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Square area minus circle area. Circle radius $= 7$ cm.

questions.question: Find the value of $x$.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><polygon points="100,20 20,150 180,150" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="60" y1="85" x2="140" y2="85" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><text x="60" y="80" font-size="12" fill="#374151">x</text><text x="100" y="165" font-size="12" fill="#374151">12 cm</text><text x="90" y="45" font-size="10" fill="#374151">The line is parallel to the base and halfway up</text></svg>
questions.hint: A line parallel to the base at half height is half the base length.

questions.question: What 3D shape does this net fold into?
questions.svg: <svg width="220" height="180" viewBox="0 0 220 180"><rect x="10" y="60" width="50" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="60" y="60" width="50" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="110" y="60" width="50" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="160" y="60" width="50" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="60" y="10" width="50" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="60" y="110" width="50" height="50" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/></svg>
questions.hint: 6 square faces form a cube.

questions.question: What is the radius of a circle with area $154 \text{ cm}^2$? ($\pi \approx \frac{22}{7}$)
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><circle cx="90" cy="90" r="65" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="90" y="95" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" fill="#374151">A = 154 cm²</text></svg>
questions.hint: Area $= \pi r^2$, so $r^2 = \frac{\text{Area}}{\pi}$, then find $r$.

questions.question: What is the sum of interior angles of a pentagon?
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><polygon points="90,20 160,65 140,150 40,150 20,65" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><text x="90" y="100" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" fill="#374151">?</text></svg>
questions.hint: Sum $= (n-2) \times 180°$ where $n$ is number of sides.

questions.question: What is the area of this triangle?
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><polygon points="20,150 180,150 100,30" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="100" y1="30" x2="100" y2="150" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><text x="100" y="165" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#374151">16 cm</text><text x="110" y="95" font-size="12" fill="#374151">9 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Area $= \frac{1}{2} \times \text{base} \times \text{height}$

questions.question: Find angle $x$ in this isosceles triangle.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><polygon points="100,20 30,150 170,150" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="95" y="50" font-size="14" fill="#374151">40°</text><text x="50" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">x</text><text x="140" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">x</text><text x="55" y="90" font-size="10" fill="#6B7280">equal sides</text></svg>
questions.hint: Triangle angles $= 180°$. Two base angles are equal in isosceles.

questions.question: What is the volume of this cube?
questions.svg: <svg width="150" height="150" viewBox="0 0 150 150"><polygon points="30,55 75,35 120,55 120,105 75,125 30,105" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="55" x2="75" y2="75" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="75" y1="75" x2="120" y2="55" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="75" y1="75" x2="75" y2="125" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="75" y="145" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#374151">6 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Volume of cube $= \text{side}^3$

questions.question: What is the area of this sector? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><path d="M 90 90 L 160 90 A 70 70 0 0 1 90 160 Z" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><text x="120" y="85" font-size="12" fill="#374151">7 cm</text><text x="115" y="130" font-size="14" fill="#374151">90°</text></svg>
questions.hint: Sector area $= \frac{\text{angle}}{360} \times \pi \times r^2$

questions.question: What is the perimeter of this semicircle? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="120" viewBox="0 0 200 120"><path d="M 20 100 A 80 80 0 0 1 180 100" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="20" y1="100" x2="180" y2="100" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="100" y="115" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#374151">10 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Perimeter = diameter + half circumference

questions.question: Find the exterior angle of a regular octagon.
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><polygon points="60,25 120,25 155,60 155,120 120,155 60,155 25,120 25,60" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="120" y1="25" x2="170" y2="25" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 135 25 A 15 15 0 0 0 145 40" fill="none" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2"/><text x="145" y="50" font-size="12" fill="#EF4444">?</text></svg>
questions.hint: Exterior angle of regular polygon $= \frac{360°}{n}$

questions.question: What is the diagonal of a square with side $5$ cm?
questions.svg: <svg width="160" height="160" viewBox="0 0 160 160"><rect x="30" y="30" width="100" height="100" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="30" x2="130" y2="130" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><text x="80" y="145" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#374151">5 cm</text><text x="90" y="75" font-size="12" fill="#EF4444">?</text></svg>
questions.hint: Use Pythagorean theorem: $d^2 = s^2 + s^2 = 2s^2$

questions.question: What is the surface area of this cylinder? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="150" height="180" viewBox="0 0 150 180"><ellipse cx="75" cy="30" rx="40" ry="12" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><ellipse cx="75" cy="150" rx="40" ry="12" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="35" y1="30" x2="35" y2="150" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="115" y1="30" x2="115" y2="150" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="120" y="95" font-size="10" fill="#374151">8 cm</text><text x="75" y="170" text-anchor="middle" font-size="10" fill="#374151">r = 3 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Surface area $= 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh$

questions.question: What is the area of a triangle with base 18 cm and height 7 cm?
questions.hint: Remember the triangle area formula involves multiplying by one-half.

questions.question: A rectangle has length 12 cm and width 8 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.hint: Perimeter adds all four sides - but there are two pairs of equal sides.

questions.question: What is the sum of interior angles in a hexagon?
questions.hint: Use the formula $(n-2) \times 180°$ where n is the number of sides.

questions.question: Find the circumference of a circle with diameter 14 cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Circumference can be calculated using the diameter directly with $\pi$.

questions.question: An angle measures $72°$. What is its supplement?
questions.hint: Supplementary angles sum to $180°$.

questions.question: What is the volume of a cube with side length 4 cm?
questions.hint: Cube volume uses the side length three times in the calculation.

questions.question: Two angles of a triangle are $55°$ and $65°$. What is the third angle?
questions.hint: All angles in a triangle must sum to $180°$.

questions.question: What is the area of a square with perimeter 32 cm?
questions.hint: First find the side length from the perimeter, then square it.

questions.question: What is the exterior angle of a regular pentagon?
questions.hint: Exterior angles of any polygon sum to $360°$.

questions.question: A parallelogram has base 15 cm and height 9 cm. What is its area?
questions.hint: Parallelogram area formula is similar to a rectangle.

questions.question: What is the area of a circle with radius 6 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Circle area involves squaring the radius.

questions.question: An angle measures $28°$. What is its complement?
questions.hint: Complementary angles sum to $90°$.

questions.question: What is the volume of a rectangular prism with length 8 cm, width 5 cm, and height 3 cm?
questions.hint: Multiply all three dimensions together.

questions.question: What is the perimeter of an equilateral triangle with side 9 cm?
questions.hint: An equilateral triangle has three equal sides.

questions.question: Find the area of a trapezoid with parallel sides 6 cm and 10 cm, and height 4 cm.
questions.hint: Average the parallel sides, then multiply by height.

questions.question: What is the sum of interior angles in an octagon?
questions.hint: Use $(n-2) \times 180°$ where n = 8.

questions.question: A circle has diameter 20 cm. What is its radius?
questions.hint: The radius is always half the diameter.

questions.question: What is the surface area of a cube with side 4 cm?
questions.hint: A cube has 6 identical square faces.

questions.question: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If one angle is $125°$, what is its corresponding angle?
questions.hint: Corresponding angles are equal when lines are parallel.

questions.question: What is the area of a rhombus with diagonals 10 cm and 14 cm?
questions.hint: Rhombus area uses half the product of its diagonals.

questions.question: What is the interior angle of a regular decagon (10 sides)?
questions.hint: Interior angle formula is $\frac{(n-2) \times 180°}{n}$.

questions.question: A triangle has sides 5 cm, 12 cm, and 13 cm. Is it a right triangle?
answers: No, because the sides are not equal
Yes, because it has three sides
questions.hint: Check if the Pythagorean theorem holds: $a^2 + b^2 = c^2$.

questions.question: What is the circumference of a circle with radius 9 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Circumference formula uses $2\pi r$.

questions.question: What is the area of a semicircle with diameter 12 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Find the full circle area first, then take half. Remember radius is half of diameter.

questions.question: A rectangle has area 84 cm² and length 12 cm. What is its width?
questions.hint: Divide the area by the length to find the width.

questions.question: What is the volume of a cylinder with radius 4 cm and height 7 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Volume uses $\pi r^2 h$ - square the radius first.

questions.question: Find angle x if angles x and 3x are supplementary.
questions.hint: Supplementary angles sum to $180°$. So $x + 3x = 180°$.

questions.question: What is the perimeter of a regular hexagon with side 7 cm?
questions.hint: A hexagon has 6 equal sides.

questions.question: What is the area of a sector with radius 8 cm and central angle $45°$? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Sector area is a fraction of the full circle based on the angle.

questions.question: What is the diagonal of a rectangle with length 8 cm and width 6 cm?
questions.hint: Use the Pythagorean theorem with length and width.

questions.question: An isosceles triangle has two equal angles of $70°$ each. What is the third angle?
questions.hint: All angles in a triangle sum to $180°$.

questions.question: What is the area of a circle with diameter 10 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: First find the radius (half of diameter), then use area formula.

questions.question: What is the volume of a cube with surface area 150 cm²?
questions.hint: First find the side length using surface area = $6s^2$.

questions.question: Two angles are vertically opposite. If one is $47°$, what is the other?
questions.hint: Vertically opposite angles are always equal.

questions.question: What is the area of a kite with diagonals 16 cm and 9 cm?
questions.hint: Kite area formula is the same as rhombus: half the product of diagonals.

questions.question: Find angle x if angles 2x and 3x are complementary.
questions.hint: Complementary angles sum to $90°$. So $2x + 3x = 90°$.

questions.question: What is the perimeter of a semicircle with radius 7 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Perimeter includes the curved part (half circumference) plus the diameter.

questions.question: A regular polygon has interior angles of $140°$. How many sides does it have?
questions.hint: Use the interior angle formula and solve for n.

questions.question: What is the area of an equilateral triangle with side 6 cm? (Use $\sqrt{3} \approx 1.73$)
questions.hint: Equilateral triangle area = $\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} \times s^2$.

questions.question: What is the volume of a triangular prism with base area 24 cm² and length 10 cm?
questions.hint: Volume = base area times length.

questions.question: A square has diagonal 10 cm. What is its area? (Use $\sqrt{2} \approx 1.41$)
questions.hint: Square area can be found from diagonal using $A = \frac{d^2}{2}$.

questions.question: What is the arc length of a 60° sector with radius 9 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Arc length = fraction of circumference based on angle.

questions.question: In a right triangle, the two legs are 6 cm and 8 cm. What is the hypotenuse?
questions.hint: Use the Pythagorean theorem: $a^2 + b^2 = c^2$.

questions.question: What is the area of the shaded region if a square of side 10 cm has a circle of diameter 10 cm inside? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Square area minus circle area.

questions.question: A trapezoid has area 60 cm², height 6 cm, and one parallel side of 8 cm. What is the other parallel side?
questions.hint: Rearrange the trapezoid area formula to solve for the unknown side.

questions.question: What is the sum of exterior angles of any convex polygon?
questions.hint: This is a constant value for all convex polygons.

questions.question: A cone has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What is its volume? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Cone volume is one-third of the corresponding cylinder volume.

questions.question: Parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If an interior angle is $68°$, what is the alternate interior angle?
questions.hint: Alternate interior angles are equal when lines are parallel.

questions.question: What is the perimeter of a rectangle with area 48 cm² and length 8 cm?
questions.hint: First find width from area, then calculate perimeter.

questions.question: A circle has area 314 cm². What is its diameter? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Find radius from area, then double for diameter.

questions.question: What is the surface area of a rectangular prism with dimensions 5 cm, 4 cm, and 3 cm?
questions.hint: Add the areas of all 6 faces (3 pairs of identical rectangles).

questions.question: In an isosceles triangle, the vertex angle is $50°$. What are the base angles?
questions.hint: The two base angles are equal and all angles sum to $180°$.

questions.question: What is the length of an arc with central angle $120°$ in a circle of radius 6 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Arc length is the fractional part of the full circumference.

questions.question: A square and a rectangle have equal perimeters of 24 cm. If the rectangle is 8 cm long, which has greater area?
questions.hint: Calculate both areas and compare. Square side = 6 cm, rectangle width = ?

questions.question: What is the area of a sector with central angle $72°$ and radius 10 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Sector area is $\frac{\text{angle}}{360} \times \pi r^2$.

questions.question: The angles of a quadrilateral are in ratio 1:2:3:4. What is the largest angle?
questions.hint: Quadrilateral angles sum to $360°$. Find x where $x + 2x + 3x + 4x = 360$.

questions.question: What is the volume of a sphere with radius 3 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Sphere volume = $\frac{4}{3}\pi r^3$.

questions.question: A right triangle has hypotenuse 17 cm and one leg 8 cm. What is the other leg?
questions.hint: Use Pythagorean theorem: $a^2 + b^2 = c^2$, solve for the unknown leg.

questions.question: What is the interior angle of a regular heptagon (7 sides)?
questions.hint: Use $\frac{(n-2) \times 180}{n}$ with n = 7.

questions.question: A parallelogram has area 72 cm² and height 6 cm. What is its base?
questions.hint: Rearrange area = base × height to find the base.

questions.question: What is the perimeter of a quarter circle with radius 8 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Quarter circle perimeter = quarter circumference + two radii.

questions.question: Two similar triangles have a ratio of sides 2:3. If the smaller triangle has area 16 cm², what is the area of the larger?
questions.hint: Areas of similar figures scale as the square of the linear ratio.

questions.question: What is the length of a diagonal of a cube with side 4 cm? (Use $\sqrt{3} \approx 1.73$)
questions.hint: Cube diagonal = side × $\sqrt{3}$.

questions.question: A triangle has angles in ratio 2:3:4. What is the smallest angle?
questions.hint: All angles sum to $180°$. Find x where $2x + 3x + 4x = 180$.

questions.question: What is the area of a regular hexagon with side 4 cm? (Use $\sqrt{3} \approx 1.73$)
questions.hint: Regular hexagon can be divided into 6 equilateral triangles.

questions.question: A cylinder has volume 628 cm³ and height 8 cm. What is its radius? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Rearrange $V = \pi r^2 h$ to solve for r.

questions.question: What is the measure of each angle in a regular 12-sided polygon?
questions.hint: Interior angle = $\frac{(n-2) \times 180}{n}$.

questions.question: A cone and cylinder have the same base and height. If the cylinder volume is 180 cm³, what is the cone volume?
questions.hint: Cone volume is what fraction of cylinder volume with same base and height?

questions.question: What is the area of a triangle with sides 5 cm, 6 cm, and 7 cm? (Use Heron's formula, $\sqrt{6} \approx 2.45$)
questions.hint: Semi-perimeter s = 9. Area = $\sqrt{s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c)}$.

questions.question: Co-interior angles on parallel lines sum to what value?
questions.hint: Also called same-side interior angles or consecutive interior angles.

questions.question: A square is inscribed in a circle of radius 5 cm. What is the side of the square? (Use $\sqrt{2} \approx 1.41$)
questions.hint: The diagonal of the inscribed square equals the diameter of the circle.

questions.question: What is the surface area of a sphere with radius 4 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Sphere surface area = $4\pi r^2$.

questions.question: A regular pentagon has perimeter 35 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.hint: Pentagon has 5 equal sides.

questions.question: What is the area of a triangle with vertices at (0,0), (6,0), and (3,4)?
questions.hint: Base = 6 units along x-axis, height = 4 units.

questions.question: A prism has a triangular base with area 15 cm² and height 12 cm. What is its volume?
questions.hint: Volume = base area × height of prism.

questions.question: Two angles are in ratio 4:5. If they are supplementary, what is the smaller angle?
questions.hint: Let angles be 4x and 5x. They sum to $180°$.

questions.question: What is the diagonal of a rectangular prism with dimensions 3 cm, 4 cm, and 5 cm? (Use $\sqrt{50} \approx 7.07$)
questions.hint: Space diagonal = $\sqrt{l^2 + w^2 + h^2}$.

questions.question: A circular garden has circumference 62.8 m. What is its area? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: First find radius from circumference, then calculate area.

questions.question: What is the area of a parallelogram with diagonals 12 cm and 16 cm that intersect at right angles?
questions.hint: When diagonals are perpendicular, area = $\frac{1}{2} \times d_1 \times d_2$.

questions.question: A scalene triangle has angles $35°$, $65°$, and what third angle?
questions.hint: All triangle angles must sum to $180°$.

questions.question: What is the slant height of a cone with radius 6 cm and height 8 cm?
questions.hint: Use Pythagorean theorem with radius and height.

questions.question: A rhombus has side 10 cm and one diagonal 12 cm. What is the other diagonal?
questions.hint: Diagonals of a rhombus bisect each other at right angles. Use Pythagorean theorem.

questions.question: What is the volume of a pyramid with square base of side 6 cm and height 10 cm?
questions.hint: Pyramid volume = $\frac{1}{3}$ × base area × height.

questions.question: If the radius of a circle is doubled, by what factor does its area increase?
questions.hint: Area depends on radius squared.

questions.question: What is the perimeter of an isosceles triangle with two equal sides of 8 cm and base 6 cm?
questions.hint: Add all three sides together.

questions.question: A sector has arc length 11 cm and radius 7 cm. What is its central angle? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Arc length = $\frac{\theta}{360} \times 2\pi r$. Solve for $\theta$.

questions.question: What is the area of an annulus (ring) with outer radius 8 cm and inner radius 5 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Subtract inner circle area from outer circle area.

questions.question: A regular polygon has exterior angles of $40°$. How many sides does it have?
questions.hint: Exterior angles sum to $360°$.

questions.question: What is the distance between points (1, 2) and (4, 6)?
questions.hint: Use the distance formula: $\sqrt{(x_2-x_1)^2 + (y_2-y_1)^2}$.

questions.question: A hexagonal prism has base edge 4 cm and height 10 cm. What is its volume? (Use $\sqrt{3} \approx 1.73$)
questions.hint: First find hexagon area, then multiply by height.

questions.question: What is the area of a segment cut off by a chord in a circle of radius 10 cm, if the central angle is $60°$? ($\pi \approx 3.14$, $\sqrt{3} \approx 1.73$)
questions.hint: Segment area = sector area - triangle area.

questions.question: An exterior angle of a triangle is $110°$. What is the sum of the two non-adjacent interior angles?
questions.hint: Exterior angle theorem: exterior angle equals sum of opposite interior angles.

questions.question: What is the area of a square inscribed in a circle of radius 7 cm?
questions.hint: Diagonal of inscribed square = diameter of circle.

questions.question: A cylinder has radius 5 cm. If its volume is 785 cm³, what is its height? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Rearrange $V = \pi r^2 h$ to solve for h.

questions.question: What is the length of a chord that subtends a $90°$ angle at the center of a circle with radius 6 cm? (Use $\sqrt{2} \approx 1.41$)
questions.hint: The chord and two radii form an isosceles right triangle.

questions.question: A rectangular field is 80 m long and 60 m wide. What is the length of its diagonal?
questions.hint: Use Pythagorean theorem.

questions.question: What is the total surface area of a cone with radius 3 cm and slant height 5 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Total surface area = $\pi r l + \pi r^2$ (curved surface + base).

questions.question: If two chords intersect inside a circle, and one chord is divided into segments of 4 cm and 6 cm, and the other chord has one segment of 3 cm, what is the other segment?
questions.hint: Intersecting chords theorem: products of segments are equal.

questions.question: What is the area of a regular octagon with side 5 cm? (Use $\sqrt{2} \approx 1.41$)
questions.hint: Regular octagon area = $2(1 + \sqrt{2})s^2$.

questions.question: A sphere is inscribed in a cube of side 10 cm. What is the volume of the sphere? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Sphere diameter equals cube side. So radius = 5 cm.

questions.question: What is the measure of an inscribed angle that subtends a semicircle?
questions.hint: An inscribed angle is half the central angle it subtends.

questions.question: A frustum of a cone has top radius 3 cm, bottom radius 6 cm, and height 4 cm. What is its slant height?
questions.hint: Use Pythagorean theorem with height and difference in radii.

questions.question: What is the midpoint of the segment joining (2, 8) and (6, 4)?
questions.hint: Midpoint formula: average the x-coordinates and y-coordinates separately.

questions.question: A triangular prism has a right triangle base with legs 3 cm and 4 cm. If the prism is 15 cm long, what is its volume?
questions.hint: First find the area of the triangular base.

questions.question: What is the area of a cyclic quadrilateral with sides 5, 5, 5, and 5 cm (a square inscribed in a circle)?
questions.hint: This is simply a square with side 5 cm.

questions.question: If the edge of a cube is increased by 50%, by what factor does its volume increase?
questions.hint: Volume scales as the cube of the linear dimension.

questions.question: What is the perimeter of a rhombus with diagonals 16 cm and 12 cm?
questions.hint: Diagonals bisect each other at right angles. Find side using Pythagorean theorem.

questions.question: A tangent and a secant are drawn from an external point. If the tangent is 8 cm and the external part of the secant is 4 cm, what is the secant's total length?
questions.hint: Tangent-secant theorem: tangent² = external segment × whole secant.

questions.question: What is the area of an ellipse with semi-major axis 7 cm and semi-minor axis 4 cm? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Ellipse area = $\pi \times a \times b$.

questions.question: A hemisphere has radius 6 cm. What is its total surface area? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Total = curved surface ($2\pi r^2$) + base circle ($\pi r^2$).
